Posts.Title: Microcalcifications - what should I be asking?

Posts.Content: I don't really know where to post this, sorry if it's wrong being here.  I have annual screening (I'm 43 now) and have had for nearly 10 years due to early bc in my mum (who had a long remission and then mets to the bowel which were terminal 14 years ago).  I had a fibroadenoma removed at the start of my screening but they mentioned calcifications last time I was screened. They assumed I knew about them but it didn't hit me till I got home and googled what they were. I phoned up a BCN was lovely and got my notes and confirmed they were microcalcifications in both breasts.  I am due my screening tomorrow and am worried now that I should be more pro-active in asking the right questions in my appointment. I just don't know what I should be asking. I have read about the scoring they give them as to whether they are benign etc, is it Rads I think it's called, but other than this not sure what to ask. Should I be pressing for a biopsy if there is any change in them?  Thanks for any help or support you can offer.

I still didn't manage to come away feeling more 'informed' but the all fine was enough for me.  Thanks for the support and advice, wish you all well and strength for when you need it.
